#Text=Rebels say 626 Ethiopian troops killed in clashes
#Text=Tuesday , November 17 , 2009
#Text=ONLF
#Text=rebelsImage : Jonathan Alpeyrie .
#Text=A rebel group in Ethiopia ' s Ogaden region said today that it has killed 626 government troops after heavy fighting near the border with neighboring Somalia .
#Text=The government , however , has dismissed the claim , calling it " a complete fabrication " .

_	_	_	_

column1: #Text=A communiqué sent to news agencies by e-mail announced that a multi-front offensive launched by the Ogaden National Liberation Front ( ONLF ) on November 10 is still in progress .
#Text=The communiqué , believed to be sent from ONLF offices in Europe , says 626 Ethiopian troops have died , and the statement says the battlefields are littered with bodies of soldiers .
#Text=It described ONLF casualties as " minimal " , but gave no details .
#Text=A rebel communiqué issued on Friday said the rebels had captured seven towns along the border with Somalia .
#Text=" The operation involved thousands of ONLF troops and resulted in two days of heavy fighting .

#Text= ONLF forces were warmly welcomed by the population in these areas and are administering medical care to those civilians killed by retreating Ethiopian occupation forces , " the statement continued .

column1: #Text=The reports could not be independently verified , as journalists are not permitted into the region .
#Text=Ethiopian government spokesman Shimelis Kemal , however , called the ONLF claims completely false .
#Text=In a telephone interview with the Voice of America news agency , he described the communiqués as a desperate measure used occasionally by the rebels to portray the region as being in turmoil .
#Text=" This group used to make exaggerated claims , " said Shimelis Kemal .
#Text="

#Text= The rebels were expelled and defeated by the local militia , " said Shimelis .

column1: #Text=" The army was not involved there .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Ethiopia calls the rebels  terrorists " backed by neighboring rival Eritrea , and with ties to the Somali group al-Shabab .

column1: #Text=Eritrea and the ONLF both denied the links , and there is no independent verification of the charges .
#Text=Government troops launched a fierce offensive against the ONLF in early 2007 after the rebels attacked a Chinese -owned oil exploration field in Ethiopia 's Ebole district , killing 74 people .
#Text=The ONLF accused the troops of conducting a " scorched earth " campaign , a claim that was strongly denied by the government .
#Text=The United Nations twice requested access to the region to conduct independent human rights assessments , but Ethiopia refused the requests .
#Text=Government spokesman Shimelis said that 2007 offensive effectively ended the ONLF 's military capability .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Since the Ebole incident , the ONLF bandit group is on the run ,  he said .
